definition: to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: There are also the purely personal predilections of each individual musician.
sentences.chinese: 每一个音乐家都有完全个人的偏爱。

sentences.english: Julie prefers the gothic architectural style while I like romanesque .
sentences.chinese: 朱莉偏爱哥特式建筑风格，而我则更喜欢罗马式的。

sentences.english: Their technique preferences are both brush stroke mainly expressed in color, and fine brushwork together with freehand brushwork.
sentences.chinese: 从表现技法看，大多偏爱工笔和兼工带写的方法。

sentences.english: The Kid's DOZER is a superb preference for kids.
sentences.chinese: 孩子的推土机是一个极好偏爱的孩子。

sentences.english: The innovation bias is particularly strong in the United States, Shenkar argues.
sentences.chinese: 申卡尔认为在美国这种偏爱创新的思想尤其强烈。

sentences.english: It is tempting to prefer the relative simplicity of dynamically-typed languages.
sentences.chinese: 它诱使我们偏爱动态语言的相对简洁。

sentences.english: Holmes was partial to cocaine, while Brett needed lithium.
sentences.chinese: 福尔摩斯偏爱可卡因，而布雷特则需要锂盐。
我偏爱舒伯特的小夜曲。

sentences.english: Professional women have a partiality for hair-shaping lotion instead of perming.
sentences.chinese: 职业妇女偏爱免烫的美发药水。

sentences.english: I prefer the old fine-lined illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 我偏爱线条细致的老式插画。

sentences.english: Galhara also prefers the anonymity of online friendships.
sentences.chinese: 盖哈啦也偏爱线上交友的匿名方式。

sentences.english: Are you more or less satisfied with expensive running shoes?
sentences.chinese: 你会不会对价格昂贵的跑鞋更偏爱一点？

sentences.english: Furthermore, possessors are the preferred targets for terrorism and theft.
sentences.chinese: 而且，有核国家是恐怖主义分子和盗窃者偏爱的目标。
我偏爱读思术胜过心理学。

sentences.english: I prefer the morning chill winding around my finger tips.
sentences.chinese: 我偏爱早晨的寒凉环绕我的指尖。

sentences.english: Most of all, he is quite favored by the Muses. His poems have been elocuted several times.
sentences.chinese: 个人较受诗神偏爱，诗作曾多次被朗诵。

definition: to treasure/to be very fond of
to have a special fondness (for sth)
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be keen on/to have a passion for
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
partial towards sth/to prefer/to incline/erroneous tendencies (Leftist or Revisionist deviation)
to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
to esteem/to think highly of/to accord importance to/to revere
